cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles SSW of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras then move into the north-western Caribbean, the Gulf of Mexico and eventually curve northeastward toward the U.S. Gulf Coast and inland across the Southeast into the Mid-Atlantic states.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: U.S. central Gulf Coast (most likely the Florida Panhandle to southeastern Louisiana)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of Nicaragua, Honduras, western Caribbean, Yucatan Peninsula, U.S. Gulf Coast states from Louisiana eastward, eventually inland Southeast and Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible early next week; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Philadelphia Regional Port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain, potentially 1-2 inches, possible Mondayâ€“Tuesday as remnant system passes inland to the west.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or urban flooding cannot be ruled out if heavier rain bands move over the Delaware Valley.
